claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.

verified_evidence.quote: Quad rival ent Recombinant Influenza Vaccine (RIV4) Available Vaccine. One recombinant influenza vaccine, Flublok Quad rival ent (RIV4), is expected to be available during the 2022-23 influenza season. RIV4 is approved for persons aged ≥18 years. This vaccine contains recombinant HA produced in an insect cell line using genetic sequences from cell derived influenza viruses and is manufactured without the use of influenza viruses or eggs (127). Dosage and Administration: RIV4 is administered by IM injection via needle and syringe. A 0.5-mL dose contains 45 µg of HA derived from each vaccine virus (180 µg total).
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly states that Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) contains 45 micrograms (µg) of HA per strain. The document also provides, in Table 1 and elsewhere, that standard-dose influenza vaccines contain 15 µg of HA per strain. Therefore, the quote explicitly and directly supports the claim that Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain versus 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 21 of the document in the section titled 'Quad rival ent Recombinant Influenza Vaccine (RIV4) Available Vaccine.' The text states: 'One recombinant influenza vaccine, Flublok Quad rival ent (RIV4), is expected to be available during the 2022-23 influenza season. RIV4 is approved for persons aged ≥18 years. This vaccine contains recombinant HA produced in an insect cell line using genetic sequences from cell derived influenza viruses and is manufactured without the use of influenza viruses or eggs (127). Dosage and Administration: RIV4 is administered by IM injection via needle and syringe. A 0.5-mL dose contains 45 µg of HA derived from each vaccine virus (180 µg total).' This matches the factual content of the quote to verify, with only minor formatting differences (e.g., 'µg' vs 'mcg', 'Quad rival ent' vs 'Quadrivalent'). The numbers and technical content are preserved.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly states that Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) contains 45 micrograms (µg) of HA per strain. The document also provides, in Table 1 and elsewhere, that standard-dose influenza vaccines contain 15 µg of HA per strain. Therefore, the quote explicitly and directly supports the claim that Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain versus 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote explicitly states that Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) contains 45 micrograms (µg) of hemagglutinin (HA) per strain, directly supporting the claim about its HA content.

verified_evidence.quote: Standard dose, nonadjuvanted IIV4 s contain 15 µg of HA per vaccine virus in a 0.5-mL dose (7.5 µg of HA per vaccine virus in a 0.25-mL dose). For 2022-23, this category is expected to include five different vaccines (Table 1).
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim by stating that standard-dose, nonadjuvanted IIV4 influenza vaccines contain 15 micrograms (µg) of HA per strain in a 0.5-mL dose. This is the comparator for Flublok, which is known (from other parts of the document) to contain 45 µg of HA per strain. The quote provides the specific number for standard-dose vaccines, which is the key fact needed to substantiate the claim's comparison.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 19 of the document: 'Standard dose, nonadjuvanted IIV4 s contain 15 µg of HA per vaccine virus in a 0.5-mL dose (7.5 µg of HA per vaccine virus in a 0.25-mL dose). For 2022-23, this category is expected to include five different vaccines (Table 1).' The wording and factual content match the quote to verify, with only minor formatting differences (e.g., 'µg' vs 'mcg', which are equivalent).
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim by stating that standard-dose, nonadjuvanted IIV4 influenza vaccines contain 15 micrograms (µg) of HA per strain in a 0.5-mL dose. This is the comparator for Flublok, which is known (from other parts of the document) to contain 45 µg of HA per strain. The quote provides the specific number for standard-dose vaccines, which is the key fact needed to substantiate the claim's comparison.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote clearly states that standard-dose influenza vaccines (IIV4s) contain 15 micrograms (µg) of HA per strain, which is the comparator for Flublok in the claim.

verified_evidence.quote: Higher dose vaccines include HD-IIV4 and RIV4, both of which contain a higher dose of HA antigen per virus than standard dose vaccines (60 µg for HD-IIV4 and 45 µg for RIV4, compared with 15 µg for standard dose in activated vaccines).
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per virus (strain), while standard dose inactivated vaccines contain 15 µg per strain, matching the claim's numbers and comparison. No inference is required; the support is explicit.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 9 of the document: 'Higher dose vaccines include HD-IIV4 and RIV4, both of which contain a higher dose of HA antigen per virus than standard dose vaccines (60 µg for HD-IIV4 and 45 µg for RIV4, compared with 15 µg for standard dose in activated vaccines).' The wording is nearly identical to the quote to verify, with only minor differences in phrasing (e.g., 'per virus' instead of 'per strain'), but the meaning and all numerical values are preserved.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 µg of HA per virus (strain), while standard dose inactivated vaccines contain 15 µg per strain, matching the claim's numbers and comparison. No inference is required; the support is explicit.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly compares the HA content of Flublok (RIV4, 45 µg per strain) to standard-dose vaccines (15 µg per strain), affirming the claim with explicit numbers.

verified_evidence.quote: [TABLE 2 - See table_p5_det_4_002.png] Flublok Quad rival ent (Sanofi Pasteur) 0.5 mL PFS ≥18 yrs 45 µg/0.5 mL IM ... Afluria Quad rival ent (Seqirus) 0.5-mL PFS ≥3 ... 15 µg/0.5 mL IM ...
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim by providing a side-by-side comparison of the HA content per strain in Flublok Quadrivalent (45 mcg/0.5 mL) and a standard-dose influenza vaccine (Afluria Quadrivalent, 15 mcg/0.5 mL). This matches the claim that Flublok contains 45 mcg of HA per strain versus 15 mcg per strain in standard-dose vaccines. No inference is required; the data is explicit.

This matches the claim that Flublok contains 45 mcg of HA per strain versus 15 mcg per strain in standard-dose vaccines. No inference is required; the data is explicit.

verified_evidence.quote: Two of these vaccines, HD-IIV and RIV, are higher dose vaccines, which contain an increased dose of HA antigen per virus compared with non adjuvanted SD-IIVs (60 µg for HD-IIV4 and 45 µg for RIV4, compared with 15 µg for standard dose inactivated vaccines). The adjuvanted vaccine contains 15 µg of HA per virus, similarly to non adjuvanted SD-IIVs, but contains the adjuvant MF59.
verified_evidence.explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain, while standard-dose inactivated vaccines contain 15 mcg of HA per strain. This matches the claim's assertion and provides the specific numbers for both Flublok and standard-dose influenza vaccines.
verified_evidence.presence_explanation: The quote appears on page 14 of the document: 'Two of these vaccines, HD-IIV and RIV, are higher dose vaccines, which contain an increased dose of HA antigen per virus compared with non adjuvanted SD-IIVs (60 µg for HD-IIV4 and 45 µg for RIV4, compared with 15 µg for standard dose inactivated vaccines). The adjuvanted vaccine contains 15 µg of HA per virus, similarly to non adjuvanted SD-IIVs, but contains the adjuvant MF59.' The factual content, numbers, and technical details are preserved and match the quote to verify.
verified_evidence.support_explanation: The quote directly supports the claim. It explicitly states that RIV4 (Flublok) contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain, while standard-dose inactivated vaccines contain 15 mcg of HA per strain. This matches the claim's assertion and provides the specific numbers for both Flublok and standard-dose influenza vaccines.
verified_evidence.original_relevance: This quote directly compares the HA content per strain in Flublok (RIV4, 45 µg) and standard-dose influenza vaccines (15 µg), supporting the claim with explicit numbers.

image_evidence.claim: Flublok contains 45 micrograms (mcg) of HA per strain vs 15 mcg of HA per strain in a standard-dose influenza vaccine.
image_evidence.explanation: A table summarizing influenza vaccines by trade name and manufacturer, presentations, age indications, micrograms of hemagglutinin (HA) per dose (µg HA per 0.5 mL or specified volume), route of administration, and mercury content. It includes categories for standard-dose egg-based IIV4 (15 µg/strain), cell culture-based cIIV4 (15 µg/strain), high-dose IIV4 (60 µg/strain), adjuvanted IIV4 (15 µg/strain), recombinant HA vaccine RIV4 (Flublok, 45 µg/strain), and live attenuated LAIV4 (virus count). Evidence: Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) shows 45 µg/0.5 mL; standard-dose egg-based IIV4 vaccines show 15 µg/0.5 mL per strain. The table directly shows Flublok contains 45 µg HA per dose versus 15 µg per dose in standard-dose influenza vaccines, which supports the claim.

detailed_analysis.image_description: A table summarizing influenza vaccines by trade name and manufacturer, presentations, age indications, micrograms of hemagglutinin (HA) per dose (µg HA per 0.5 mL or specified volume), route of administration, and mercury content. It includes categories for standard-dose egg-based IIV4 (15 µg/strain), cell culture-based cIIV4 (15 µg/strain), high-dose IIV4 (60 µg/strain), adjuvanted IIV4 (15 µg/strain), recombinant HA vaccine RIV4 (Flublok, 45 µg/strain), and live attenuated LAIV4 (virus count).
detailed_analysis.evidence_found: Flublok Quadrivalent (RIV4) shows 45 µg/0.5 mL; standard-dose egg-based IIV4 vaccines show 15 µg/0.5 mL per strain.
detailed_analysis.reasoning: The table directly shows Flublok contains 45 µg HA per dose versus 15 µg per dose in standard-dose influenza vaccines, which supports the claim.
